title: Typography in Budapest?
content:
Hello everyone!

I’m leaving Stockholm for Budapest in mid-February and I was wondering if somebody could help me with site propositions (typography related of course), anything from bookstores to cemeteries. All suggestions will be greatly appreciated.

KTKM

 [‹ What about Fontpool.com?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123032304/http:/www.typophile.com/node/10261 "Go to previous forum topic") [Samuel De Swaef ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123032304/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39577 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Kristian M

comments.content:
I don’t know about book stores or cemeteries, but when I went there about 5 years ago, lots of old shop signage was still in existence. But the city was obviously changing fast - building sites everywhere, and fantastic old buildings being demolished. If you do a lot of walking you may still stumble across some gems.

Good luck!

Nick Cooke

Kristian, I wrote you an email through your Konstfack address.  
p.s. I had a course with Prof. Ulf Klarén back in 2001, way cool !

<cite>lots of old shop signage was still in existence. But the city was obviously changing fast - building sites everywhere, and fantastic old buildings being demolished</cite>

Yes, there’s an interesting article about that very topic in [Ultrabold](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123032304/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Ultrabold) #1, a [journal published](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123032304/http:/stbride.org/friends/publications/ultrabold) by the [St Bride Library](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123032304/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/St%252BBride%252BLibrary).
